intro: Echinopsilon brachypterus, commonly known as the short-winged spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its succulent, spiny stems and small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the spurge family. The plant is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy soils. It has adapted to survive in harsh environments through its water-storing tissues and reduced leaf surfaces. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is often found in disturbed habitats and can be an indicator of environmental stress.
